discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Path traversal is also known as directory traversal. These vulnerabilities enable an attacker to read arbitrary files on the server that is running an application.

questions.question_text: Which attack gives unauthorized access to files on the web server?
Which feature does the IaaS model provide?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Not C - that is the IaaS customers responsibility. 
Not d: VMs can be resized by IaaS customer
B ? IaaS customer has granular control of data, but cannot decide of exact physical location of data. I go with A - SD network segmentation can be made by IaaS customer

Selected Answer: B
I agree with ton99. Most plausible answer.

I think he right answer is B:

In the IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service) model, customers have significant control over their data and the deployed infrastructure. This includes responsibilities like managing and patching operating systems, virtual networks, and applications. As noted in the official Guide:

"In an IaaS environment, the CSP (Cloud Service Provider) is responsible only for patching the hypervisors, physical compute and storage servers, and the physical network. You are responsible for patching the applications, operating systems (VMs), and any virtual networks you deploy"

Selected Answer: A

are handled by the provider so I guess the good answer is A, the OS is not part of IASS

questions.question_text: What is a benefit of using Cisco CWS compared to an on-premises Cisco Secure Web Appliance?

choices.C: CWS minimizes the load on the internal network and security infrastructure as compared to Secure Web Appliance.
choices.D: URL categories are updated more frequently on CWS than they are on Secure Web Appliance.
choices.B: Content scanning for SAAS cloud applications is available through CWS and not available through Secure Web Appliance.
choices.A: CWS eliminates the need to backhaul traffic through headquarters for remote workers whereas Secure Web Appliance does not.
